name: Palms Inn
text: I'm new to the area and needed a place to live temporarily. I've been staying here for nearly 2 months so far and would reccomend this place. This place is huge! It is a former Ramada hotel that went out of business sometime last year and whoever bought it decided to turn it into a short term apartment building/week to week hotel. They are the cheapest short term/week to week motel that you're going to find in Orlando. I pay $220 a week for myself (all inclusive: including Tax, utilities, garbage, etc). More people cost extra. They have security at night so although it's located a half mile from the Orange County jail, you won't feel unsafe here. Front desk staff are friendly as well. My only complaint is that the internet doesn't work often in my room but my room might be too far away from the router/front desk. There are also bugs in my room daily as well, although they did spray the rooms recently. My room does have a balcony which is a huge plus and there's a pool open during the warmer months. Would recommend staying here overall!!

text:
I don't know where to begin- There are hidden fees such as safe charges $2 daily whether you use it or not and the parking is in a garage located on the backside of the hotel - $8 daily plus taxes of course. If you drive a 4x4 this is not for you - 7ft clearance. Not a good experience. Gate came down on roof of truck- went to front desk and their response was "Not our problem"............WTF! Nothing on the internet said anything about a parking garage and clearance issues nor extra charges. I didn't see any - my bad if there was! We booked 2 rooms - they did put us side by side - Rooms 312 & 314

There is a refrigerator in the room, but would you like rust with it? Ours was rusted so bad the door was barely hanging on. It was still working- bought a 6 pack of cokes and they were frozen solid by the morning. Wow!

Beds and bathroom were OK - just had to call down to have towels delivered- that was a joke! We had 3 people in each room and they left one towel and one bath mat each day. No wash cloths! The front desk person said "Yes, we have towels here, but you have to come get them- wash cloths were not available- they were all taken."

Front desk people were very rude no matter if it was first thing in the morning, 4pm or midnight. Birds were flying around in lobby.

The person responsible for the breakfast bar which consisted of mini-muffins, cereal, coffee, milk and oj would crunch up the cereal and feed the birds at the end of the bar. Hmmm- sanitary issues?

On the bright side - we did receive our wake up call every morning at 5am sharp!

Please spend the extra $20-$30 per night at the Comfort Suites or LaQuinta Inn- I know I will next year. This is the first time and last time at the Best Miami Hotel - Best Kept Secret - Well, I know why now!

text:
I love a good lazy river and this one has lots of great things! The decor is lush and shady in many places. The water path opens into multiple pools, large and small, along the way with many easy entrances and exits. There are several bridges over the river, most with a water spout shooting a stream into the water below. There are several waterfalls along the edges of the way, just enough falling to keep you cool. With two towel/shop areas on both sides of the pool makes them easily accessible to swimmers. There were plenty of chairs, but fewer umbrellas so that might be a problem on busy days if you want shade. There is a shallow pool for non-swimmers and babies. name: Hilton Grand Vacations Sales Center
text: First of all, this is not a timeshare. This is actually a pretty good idea by Hilton. You are able to become an owner and stay in places for only $67 a night. There only catch is they do attempt to gather a down payment and you will have a monthly payment until the ownership price is paid off. The price varies from couple to couple and/or family to family, depending on what you feel you will be able to utilize as far as room size and the amount of stays per year you estimate you will utilize. It can be as low as 8500 to 30 or 40 thousand an ownership and once you pay that amount off you don't pay anymore but keep continuing to reap more of the benefits of being an owner while you're paying and after it's paid off as well. The staff was very friendly and pleasant, although these guys and gals are slick and have been trained well it did seem not to be as genuine as they would have you believe. Once again the service was amazing and the staff was super friendly but if you anything about sales you can see right through each tactic that the sales individuals attempt to deploy. They are trained well and do a great job at it. The last thing I will add is they are not however pushy. They present the deal, shine it up and serve it to you on a nice shiny platter, but once you deny the offer they continue to be nice but stop selling the plan, great job. The only real negative reply I will add is we were told we would receive a free gift for hearing the presentation and we did not.

They deducted an extra $25 as a deposit in case there was any damages in the room after I left, this would be returned to my card if no damages were made. I can definitely understand this, but it was not mentioned to me at all upon booking my room which was very upsetting. When I first initially reserved the room, I was informed my grand total would be $380, but then the price raised to $410, and then it raised to $477. name: Best Western Plus Seaport Inn Downtown
text: Too many positive vocabulary words to use regarding this hotel. Firstly, what a gorgeous neighborhood! Old New York, clear as day! Gorgeous views of the Brooklyn Bridge! Large pedestrian-friendly location with rental bikes and a pick-up location for various tours. Staff is FIVE STAR. The manager was voraciously accommodating and made sure we had everything we needed while seeming genuinely happy to be at work. And the attitude showed throughout the establishment. It was my mom's first time to New York and it couldn't have been more perfect! Thank you so much for making this an unforgettable trip!

name: Best Western Plus Seaport Inn Downtown
text: This hotel is great because of the location and convenience of being in downtown Manhattan. It's an old building, with old elevators. Could use some updating. The rooms are nice enough but not nice enough for the $$ that they charge per night. Breakfast was basically a cold breakfast, except for the "eggs" which I think were badly reconstituted powdered eggs. I've stayed in hotels that cost way less, but have infinitely better breakfasts.

name: Best Western Plus Seaport Inn Downtown
text: Although we've been to the City many times over the years, July 2015 was our first time staying at this hotel or in Seaport. Our room was clean, and most of the staff was very nice (one of the breakfast ladies got an attitude when we asked for cream cheese for the bagels...they were out). The neighborhood was nice, a lot more quiet compared to uptown where we usually stay, especially at night. The Fulton St station we needed was down, unfortunately, though, so we ended up having to walk to City Hall every time: a brisk 12-15 minutes. It was pretty inconvenient, but we got a lot of exercise. :) The parking rates listed on their website were not updated, so be sure to clarify this before you book.

name: Best Western Plus Seaport Inn Downtown
text: Great hotel. However the room I paid for was not avaiable when I checked in and they tried to cover it up by giving me an upgrade. The room I was upgraded to was smaller than I needed for the first night. Otherwise it was an awesome experience.

name: Best Western Plus Seaport Inn Downtown
text: This is not a 5 star hotel, but it sure is a nice and cozy place to stay in Downtown, NY. The room was clean and spacious, the clerk at the front desk was extraordinarily nice, and the staff was very helpful.
